controllers.initÂ¶

Source: src\controllers\__init__.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Clean SMC Controllers Package

Provides unified access to 4 core SMC controllers optimized for research and PSO tuning:

  • Classical SMC

  • Adaptive SMC

  • Super-Twisting SMC

  • Hybrid Adaptive-STA SMC

Usage Examples: # PSO-optimized controller creation from controllers import create_smc_for_pso, SMCType controller = create_smc_for_pso(SMCType.CLASSICAL, gains=[10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 5])

# Direct controller instantiation
from controllers import ClassicalSMC
controller = ClassicalSMC(gains=[10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 5], max_force=100.0)

# Clean factory usage
from controllers import SMCFactory, SMCConfig
config = SMCConfig(gains=[10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 5], max_force=100.0)
controller = SMCFactory.create_controller(SMCType.CLASSICAL, config)

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#============================ src/controllers/__init__.py =============================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Clean SMC Controllers Package
  7
  8Provides unified access to 4 core SMC controllers optimized for research and PSO tuning:
  9- Classical SMC
 10- Adaptive SMC
 11- Super-Twisting SMC
 12- Hybrid Adaptive-STA SMC
 13
 14Usage Examples:
 15    # PSO-optimized controller creation
 16    from controllers import create_smc_for_pso, SMCType
 17    controller = create_smc_for_pso(SMCType.CLASSICAL, gains=[10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 5])
 18
 19    # Direct controller instantiation
 20    from controllers import ClassicalSMC
 21    controller = ClassicalSMC(gains=[10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 5], max_force=100.0)
 22
 23    # Clean factory usage
 24    from controllers import SMCFactory, SMCConfig
 25    config = SMCConfig(gains=[10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 5], max_force=100.0)
 26    controller = SMCFactory.create_controller(SMCType.CLASSICAL, config)
 27"""
 28
 29# ============================================================================
 30# CLEAN SMC API - PRIMARY INTERFACE
 31# ============================================================================
 32
 33# Import the clean SMC factory from factory package
 34from .factory import (
 35    # Core types
 36    SMCType,
 37    SMCConfig,
 38    SMCFactory,
 39
 40    # PSO-optimized functions
 41    create_smc_for_pso,
 42    get_gain_bounds_for_pso,
 43    validate_smc_gains,
 44
 45    # Specifications
 46    SMC_GAIN_SPECS
 47)
 48
 49# Import individual SMC controllers for direct access
 50try:
 51    from .smc.classic_smc import ClassicalSMC
 52    from .smc.adaptive_smc import AdaptiveSMC
 53    from .smc.sta_smc import SuperTwistingSMC
 54    from .smc.hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc import HybridAdaptiveSTASMC
 55except ImportError:
 56    # Import fallback - controllers may not be available in all contexts
 57    ClassicalSMC = None
 58    AdaptiveSMC = None
 59    SuperTwistingSMC = None
 60    HybridAdaptiveSTASMC = None
 61
 62# ============================================================================
 63# OPTIONAL CONTROLLERS (for comparison/specialized use)
 64# ============================================================================
 65
 66# Only import if you need them for comparison studies
 67try:
 68    from .mpc.mpc_controller import MPCController, MPCWeights  # noqa: F401 (used in __all__ below)
 69    _HAS_MPC = True
 70except ImportError:
 71    _HAS_MPC = False
 72
 73try:
 74    from .specialized.swing_up_smc import SwingUpSMC  # noqa: F401 (used in __all__ below)
 75    _HAS_SWING_UP = True
 76except ImportError:
 77    _HAS_SWING_UP = False
 78
 79# Legacy factory for backward compatibility
 80from .factory import create_controller_legacy
 81
 82# ============================================================================
 83# CLEAN PUBLIC API
 84# ============================================================================
 85
 86__all__ = [
 87    # ========================================
 88    # PRIMARY SMC API (USE THESE)
 89    # ========================================
 90
 91    # SMC Controller Types
 92    "SMCType",
 93    "ClassicalSMC",
 94    "AdaptiveSMC",
 95    "SuperTwistingSMC",
 96    "HybridAdaptiveSTASMC",
 97
 98    # Clean Factory Interface
 99    "SMCFactory",
100    "SMCConfig",
101
102    # PSO Integration (OPTIMIZED FOR YOUR RESEARCH)
103    "create_smc_for_pso",
104    "get_gain_bounds_for_pso",
105    "validate_smc_gains",
106
107    # Gain Specifications
108    "SMC_GAIN_SPECS",
109
110    # ========================================
111    # SECONDARY API (optional)
112    # ========================================
113
114    # Legacy compatibility
115    "create_controller_legacy",
116]
117
118# Add optional controllers to __all__ if available
119if _HAS_MPC:
120    __all__.extend(["MPCController", "MPCWeights"])
121
122if _HAS_SWING_UP:
123    __all__.append("SwingUpSMC")
124
125# ============================================================================
126# CONVENIENCE FUNCTIONS FOR COMMON RESEARCH PATTERNS
127# ============================================================================
128
129def create_all_smc_controllers(
130    gains_dict: dict[str, list[float]],
131    max_force: float = 100.0,
132    dt: float = 0.01
133) -> dict[str, any]:
134    """
135    Create all 4 SMC controllers at once for comparison studies.
136
137    Args:
138        gains_dict: Dictionary mapping controller names to their gains
139                   e.g., {"classical": [10,8,15,12,50,5], "adaptive": [10,8,15,12,0.5]}
140        max_force: Maximum control force
141        dt: Control timestep
142
143    Returns:
144        Dictionary of initialized SMC controllers
145
146    Example:
147        gains = {
148            "classical": [10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 5],
149            "adaptive": [10, 8, 15, 12, 0.5],
150            "sta": [25, 10, 15, 12, 20, 15],
151            "hybrid": [15, 12, 18, 15]
152        }
153        controllers = create_all_smc_controllers(gains)
154    """
155    controllers = {}
156
157    type_mapping = {
158        "classical": SMCType.CLASSICAL,
159        "adaptive": SMCType.ADAPTIVE,
160        "sta": SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING,
161        "super_twisting": SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING,
162        "hybrid": SMCType.HYBRID
163    }
164
165    for name, gains in gains_dict.items():
166        if name.lower() in type_mapping:
167            smc_type = type_mapping[name.lower()]
168            controllers[name] = create_smc_for_pso(
169                smc_type=smc_type,
170                gains=gains,
171                max_force=max_force,
172                dt=dt
173            )
174        else:
175            raise ValueError(f"Unknown SMC controller type: {name}")
176
177    return controllers
178
179def get_all_gain_bounds() -> dict[str, list[tuple[float, float]]]:
180    """Get PSO gain bounds for all SMC controller types."""
181    return {
182        "classical": get_gain_bounds_for_pso(SMCType.CLASSICAL),
183        "adaptive": get_gain_bounds_for_pso(SMCType.ADAPTIVE),
184        "sta": get_gain_bounds_for_pso(SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING),
185        "hybrid": get_gain_bounds_for_pso(SMCType.HYBRID)
186    }
187
188# Add convenience functions to exports
189__all__.extend(["create_all_smc_controllers", "get_all_gain_bounds"])
190

FunctionsÂ¶

create_all_smc_controllers(gains_dict, max_force, dt)Â¶

Create all 4 SMC controllers at once for comparison studies.

Args: gains_dict: Dictionary mapping controller names to their gains e.g., {â€œclassicalâ€: [10,8,15,12,50,5], â€œadaptiveâ€: [10,8,15,12,0.5]} max_force: Maximum control force dt: Control timestep

Returns: Dictionary of initialized SMC controllers

Example: gains = { â€œclassicalâ€: [10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 5], â€œadaptiveâ€: [10, 8, 15, 12, 0.5], â€œstaâ€: [25, 10, 15, 12, 20, 15], â€œhybridâ€: [15, 12, 18, 15] } controllers = create_all_smc_controllers(gains)

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def create_all_smc_controllers(
 2    gains_dict: dict[str, list[float]],
 3    max_force: float = 100.0,
 4    dt: float = 0.01
 5) -> dict[str, any]:
 6    """
 7    Create all 4 SMC controllers at once for comparison studies.
 8
 9    Args:
10        gains_dict: Dictionary mapping controller names to their gains
11                   e.g., {"classical": [10,8,15,12,50,5], "adaptive": [10,8,15,12,0.5]}
12        max_force: Maximum control force
13        dt: Control timestep
14
15    Returns:
16        Dictionary of initialized SMC controllers
17
18    Example:
19        gains = {
20            "classical": [10, 8, 15, 12, 50, 5],
21            "adaptive": [10, 8, 15, 12, 0.5],
22            "sta": [25, 10, 15, 12, 20, 15],
23            "hybrid": [15, 12, 18, 15]
24        }
25        controllers = create_all_smc_controllers(gains)
26    """
27    controllers = {}
28
29    type_mapping = {
30        "classical": SMCType.CLASSICAL,
31        "adaptive": SMCType.ADAPTIVE,
32        "sta": SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING,
33        "super_twisting": SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING,
34        "hybrid": SMCType.HYBRID
35    }
36
37    for name, gains in gains_dict.items():
38        if name.lower() in type_mapping:
39            smc_type = type_mapping[name.lower()]
40            controllers[name] = create_smc_for_pso(
41                smc_type=smc_type,
42                gains=gains,
43                max_force=max_force,
44                dt=dt
45            )
46        else:
47            raise ValueError(f"Unknown SMC controller type: {name}")
48
49    return controllers

get_all_gain_bounds()Â¶

Get PSO gain bounds for all SMC controller types.

Source CodeÂ¶

1def get_all_gain_bounds() -> dict[str, list[tuple[float, float]]]:
2    """Get PSO gain bounds for all SMC controller types."""
3    return {
4        "classical": get_gain_bounds_for_pso(SMCType.CLASSICAL),
5        "adaptive": get_gain_bounds_for_pso(SMCType.ADAPTIVE),
6        "sta": get_gain_bounds_for_pso(SMCType.SUPER_TWISTING),
7        "hybrid": get_gain_bounds_for_pso(SMCType.HYBRID)
8    }
